description: Docs: PRD exists and references dependency plans correctly
Migration: Draft workflow definitions accept null/empty payload schema ref
Migration: Existing published workflows remain unchanged after migration
Migration: payload schema mode metadata column(s) exist and default to inferred for new drafts
Migration: Backfill sets payload schema mode to pinned for drafts that already have payloadSchemaRef
Unit: WorkflowDefinition draft schema supports payloadSchemaMode field
Unit: Published WorkflowDefinition schema requires payloadSchemaRef
Unit: Schema registry registers generated schema under workflow.<workflowId>.payload.v<version>
API: list/get schema endpoints include generated workflow payload schemas
Unit: Generated payload schema registration is deterministic given same inputs
UI: Designer shows 'Workflow data contract' section instead of requiring payload schema pick
UI: New workflow starts in inferred contract mode
UI: Advanced toggle enables pinning payload schema ref
UI: Pinning mode shows schema select + advanced input
UI: Inferred mode hides/disables payload schema selection controls
UI: Inferred mode displays an 'Effective schema (design time)' preview label
UI: Pinned mode displays 'Pinned contract schema' label and preview
UI: Published version displays 'Published contract schema' ref and preview
Unit: Effective data context includes event.payload typed by trigger schema
Unit: Effective data context includes vars.<saveAs> typed by output schema where available
Unit: Unknown output schemas are surfaced as unknown type in effective context
Unit: Expression editor context uses effective schema (inferred/pinned) as payload typing source
Unit: Mapping panel target fields derive from effective payload schema
UI: Trigger section clearly distinguishes trigger schema vs payload contract
UI: Trigger section shows schema ref/status + View schema link

UI: Tenant event with missing schema selectable but disables publish/run
UI: Publish/run disabled while event catalog is still loading (no transient error banner)
UI: Publish/run disabled while required schema previews are still loading (shows skeleton)
Persistence: Saving draft persists payload schema mode and any pinned ref
Unit: Effective payload schema inference returns a JSON schema object for draft previews
Unit: Inference input includes trigger schema and ordered step output schemas
Unit: Inference merges known outputs into vars namespace in a stable way
Perf: Inference recompute is cached/debounced and only triggers on structural changes
Publish: Inferred mode publishes by generating a payload contract schema snapshot
Publish: Generated schema snapshot registers in schema registry successfully
Publish: Generated schemaRef is stored on the published workflow version with provenance
Publish: Optionally copies generated payload schema ref into draft after publish (if enabled)
Publish: Pinned mode validates the pinned schemaRef exists (unknown is error)
Publish: Determinism — re-publishing same draft without changes yields same contract schema content
Publish: Failure — schema registry registration failure blocks publish with actionable error
Validator: Draft save allowed with missing payload schema ref in inferred mode
Validator: Deep nested mapping validation catches missing required nested fields
Validator: Missing secret referenced in mapping/expression produces an error
Validator: Type mismatch where both sides known produces an error
Validator: Type mismatch where either side unknown produces a warning
Validator: Validation details persist inferred vs pinned mode and effective schema diagnostics
Run dialog: Form builder uses trigger schema to build event payload input
Run dialog: Applying trigger mapping produces workflow payload and validates against contract
Run dialog: When trigger schema missing/unknown, run is disabled with error
Run dialog: Inferred mode (unpublished) can generate ephemeral contract preview for run UX
Execution: Runs use published payloadSchemaRef contract and do not depend on inferred schema
Execution: Trigger mapping semantics from 2025-12-27 plan remain unchanged
UI: Schema preview modal supports inferred schema rendering (no ref) with syntax highlighting
UI: Modal indicates whether schema is inferred vs pinned vs published
UI: Skeleton loaders appear for inferred schema computation sections (no blank gaps)
UI: If inference fails, draft can still be saved but publish is blocked and error shown
Event catalog: All system events used in designer have schema refs (enforced)
Event catalog: Designer trigger selector displays event schema status consistently
Telemetry: Emits event when user toggles inferred<->pinned mode
Telemetry: Emits event when publish generates payload contract schema ref
Telemetry: Emits event when publish blocked due to missing schema/mapping/secrets
Permissions: Pinning payload schema is blocked without workflow:manage
Permissions: Publishing payload contract is blocked without workflow:publish
Security: Tenant is inferred and never editable in test event builders
API: Workflow definition read APIs include payload schema mode + provenance
Audit: Published contract schema ref appears in workflow audit/history
Edge: Manual (no trigger) workflow cannot publish in inferred mode without pinned schema (blocked)
Edge: Non-event triggers (future) have defined inference behavior (documented or blocked)
Docs: Help text explains trigger schema vs payload contract and inferred vs pinned modes

UX: 'Generate contract now' button produces preview of publish-time schemaRef and schema
UX: Warn when inferred contract differs from current pinned/published contract
Perf: Schema registry lookups for generated schema registration are cached
Observability: Validation persistence stores effective schema summary hash
Sanity: Features.json contains > 75 features
Sanity: Tests.json contains at least as many entries as features.json
UI: Contract section shows default message 'Contract will be generated on publish' in inferred mode
UI: Switching to pinned mode requires selecting a schema (and shows validation when unknown)
UI: Switching from pinned -> inferred clears pinned ref (or preserves but ignores) per spec
Unit: Effective schema uses pinned schemaRef when mode=pinned
Unit: Effective schema uses inferred schema when mode=inferred
Unit: Effective schema recompute invalidates when trigger changes

Validator: Pinned mode uses pinned schema for required mapping checks

API: Workflow definition provenance fields appear in get workflow response

Registry: Generated schema registration is idempotent for same ref (update/overwrite rules are consistent)

UI: Warning appears when inferred contract differs from pinned/published contract

Edge: Future non-event trigger types are rejected or handled per documented behavior
Performance: Effective schema computation does not block typing in the designer UI
Performance: Effective schema computation scales to 100+ steps without noticeable lag
Security: Only workflow:manage can toggle pin mode and change contract settings
Security: Read-only users can view effective schema preview but cannot change contract settings
Docs: PRD acceptance criteria covers 'build without schema', 'publish generates contract', and 'stable across trigger changes'

Compat: Existing published workflows continue to execute without changes to payloadSchemaRef
